answers.answer: A person with diabetes, the risks with bypass surgery complications are higher. Although problems don't happen very often, it's more likely for your father to have infections or to take longer to recover.With a history of diabetes your father probably already knows that an infection at the procedure site can make it difficult to control blood sugar and may require IV antibiotics to treat the infection. Worst case scenario.
